questions.question_text: Select the statement which correctly returns the global target.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C: getGlobalTarget(String indicator, Object onDate)
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/washingtondc-now-intelligence/page/use/performance-analytics/PAFormulaUtil/reference/PAFU-getGlobalTarget_S_O.html

Selected Answer: C
getGlobalTarget(String indicator, Object onDate)
Returns the global target associated with the specified indicator for the specified date.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/washingtondc-now-intelligence/page/use/performance-analytics/PAFormulaUtil/concept/PAFormulaUtils.html

The correct statement to return the global target is:

A. pa.getTarget([[Number of open incidents]], score_end)

The `pa.getTarget()` function is used to retrieve the target for a specific indicator and a specific date. The `[[Number of open incidents]]` represents the indicator for which the target is being retrieved, and `score_end` is likely a variable representing the date for which the target should be retrieved.

questions.question_text: The scores of an Automated Indicator are correct as of:

discussion.content:
The scores of an Automated Indicator are correct as of:

A. Most recent Collection time

Automated Indicators in Performance Analytics are updated according to their data collection schedule. The scores reflect the state of the data at the time the most recent collection job was executed, not when they are viewed or based on a specific time zone's midnight.

choices.B: The time the indicator is viewed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - tested in instance

When the precision is set to 2 and an Indicator stores the value 4250.2, in a Score widget, the value displayed will be:

A. 4.25k

The precision setting controls the number of decimal places to display, and commonly, values in the thousands may be represented with a 'k' to denote thousands. Therefore, the number 4250.2 would be formatted as 4.25k with two decimal places of precision.

questions.question_text:
An Indicator stores the value 4250.2.

If the Precision is set to 2, what is displayed in a Score widget?
What happens when Collect records is enabled on the Indicator form?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B- Check box to indicate if the individual record sys_ids are stored when the indicator is collected. Selecting this check box enables you to drill down to those details in the Analytics Hub and widgets. When available, collected records appear on the Records tab.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-now-intelligence/page/use/performance-analytics/task/t_CreateAnAutomatedIndicator.html

When "Collect records" is enabled on the Indicator form:

B. A list of sys_ids is stored during collection to allow drill down to records.

This option allows users to drill down into the specific records that contribute to an indicator's score, giving more detailed insight into the data that comprises the metric. The list of sys_ids that correspond to these records is stored, enabling this functionality.

choices.B: A list of sys_ids is stored during collection to allow drill down to records.
choices.C: An ad-hoc job runs to collect the scores immediately for testing purposes.
choices.D: An exact copy of the matching records are retained for future reference.
choices.A: A preview of the records that match the condition is displayed.

choices.B: Facts table: Incident | Conditions: Resolved on Today AND Value is Assignment Group
choices.D: Facts table: Incident Metric | Conditions: Resolved on Today AND Value is Assignment Group
choices.A: Facts table: Incident Metric | Conditions: Resolved on Today AND Definition is Assignment Group
choices.C: Facts table: Incident | Conditions: Resolved on Today AND Definition is Assignment Group

discussion.content:
For the configuration of the Indicator Source for the Average Assignment Duration Indicator, considering you want to trend the duration that Resolved Incidents are assigned to Assignment Groups and there is an existing metric tracking this duration, you would configure the Indicator Source as:

A. Facts table: Incident Metric | Conditions: Resolved is Today AND Definition is Assignment Group

This configuration uses the 'Incident Metric' facts table which likely stores the metrics related to incidents, including the duration incidents are assigned to groups. The conditions ensure that only metrics for incidents resolved today are included and that the metrics correspond to the Assignment Group duration.

questions.question_text:
Consider the following configurations and requirements:
• You plan to set up an Indicator, Average Assignment Duration, to trend the duration of time Resolved Incidents are assigned to Assignment Groups.
• There is an existing metric called Assignment Group which already tracks the duration of time an Incident is assigned to different Assignment Groups.

How would you configure the Indicator Source for the Average Assignment Duration Indicator?
